message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about improving Neural Machine Translation (NMT) using character-level features, specifically the radicals of Chinese characters. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and machine learning. Additionally, the paper uses deep learning techniques, which could also place it in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of NMT also suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method using perplexity and BLEU, which are common metrics in information retrieval, suggesting cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as a less likely but still possible sub-category.
